articles.author: Alexander Cornwell, Parisa Hafezi, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Before leaving for the world leaders summit, U.S. President Donald Trump said, "I hope there's going to be a deal."
articles.title: Israel-Iran battle escalates, will be high on agenda as world leaders meet

articles.author: David Ljunggren, John Irish, Andreas Rinke
articles.description: Leaders from the Group of Seven nations began annual talks on Monday with wars in Ukraine and the Middle East adding to global economic uncertainty, as host Canada tries to avoid a clash with U.S. President Donald Trump.
articles.title: G7 leaders aim for unity, facing escalating wars in Ukraine, Middle East

articles.author: Nathan Layne
articles.description: A man accused of killing a Democratic state lawmaker while posing as a police officer is expected to appear in a Minnesota court on Monday afternoon on state murder charges, after a massive two-day manhunt ended with his arrest on Sunday night.
articles.title: Suspect in Minnesota lawmaker killing to appear in court on murder charges

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali
articles.description: The U.S. military has moved a large number of refueling aircraft to Europe to provide options to President Donald Trump as Middle East tensions erupt into conflict between Iran and Israel, two U.S. officials told Reuters on Monday, speaking on condition of anonymity.
articles.title: Exclusive: US bolsters Trump's Middle East military options by moving refueling aircraft, officials say

articles.author: Jason Lange
articles.description: President Donald Trump's public approval rating held steady over the last month, but Americans are becoming less supportive of his approach to immigration as his administration cracks down, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll that closed on Monday.
articles.title: Trump approval steady at 42%, support weakens for his immigration policy, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday Iran should have signed a deal with the United States on its nuclear program before Israeli strikes began and that he believes they now want to make an agreement.
articles.title: Trump predicts Iran will sign nuclear deal

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: A congressman from President Donald Trump's Republican Party has raised concerns with the Trump administration about the U.S. detention of Venezuelan activist Gregory Sanabria Tarazona, who had been seeking asylum in the United States.
articles.title: Republican US lawmaker concerned about Venezuelan activist's detention by ICE

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba and U.S. President Donald Trump did not reach a tariff agreement, Fuji TV reported on Tuesday.
articles.title: Japan PM Ishiba, Trump did not reach tariff agreement, Fuji TV reports

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump and British Prime Minister Keir Starmer said on Monday they had finalized a trade deal reached between the two allies last month.
articles.title: Trump signs proclamation to implement US-UK trade deal, Starmer calls it 'sign of strength'

articles.author: Gram Slattery
articles.description: The Trump administration has tapped a former army special operations officer with significant business experience who once oversaw a large U.S.-Russia investment forum to manage Europe and Russia policy at the National Security Council, two U.S. officials said.
articles.title: National Security Council taps ex-soldier with business experience for top Europe role
